name: apple_pie
healthier_suggestion: Baked apples with cinnamon and a sprinkle of oats. This reduces the fat from the crust and refined sugar.

name: baby_back_ribs
healthier_suggestion: Grilled pork tenderloin with a dry rub instead of a sugary BBQ sauce. It offers a much leaner cut of pork.

name: baklava
healthier_suggestion: A small handful of walnuts with a drizzle of honey, or Greek yogurt with fruit and nuts to capture the flavor profile with less sugar and butter.

name: beef_carpaccio
healthier_suggestion: This is already a relatively healthy, high-protein choice. To make it healthier, ask for less oil/dressing and cheese.

name: beef_tartare
healthier_suggestion: Similar to carpaccio, this is high in protein. Opt for lean beef and serve with whole-grain crackers or cucumber slices instead of fries or white bread toast.

name: beet_salad
healthier_suggestion: A very healthy option. To improve it, use a light vinaigrette dressing and limit high-fat additions like goat cheese and candied nuts.

name: beignets
healthier_suggestion: Whole-wheat pancakes or a baked donut. This reduces the amount of oil from deep frying.

name: bibimbap
healthier_suggestion: Ask for brown rice instead of white, double the vegetables, and use gochujang sauce sparingly to control sodium and sugar.

name: bread_pudding
healthier_suggestion: Overnight oats made with milk, fruit, and spices. It provides a similar creamy texture with more fiber and less sugar.

name: breakfast_burrito
healthier_suggestion: A breakfast scramble with eggs/tofu, black beans, and veggies in a bowl (no tortilla), or use a whole-wheat tortilla with less cheese and no sour cream.

name: bruschetta
healthier_suggestion: A fairly healthy appetizer. Use whole-grain bread and maximize the fresh tomato topping while minimizing the oil drizzle.

name: caesar_salad
healthier_suggestion: A grilled chicken salad with a vinaigrette-based dressing. The calories in a Caesar salad come from the creamy dressing, cheese, and croutons.

name: cannoli
healthier_suggestion: A bowl of ricotta cheese mixed with a little vanilla, sweetener, and mini chocolate chips. This removes the fried pastry shell.

name: caprese_salad
healthier_suggestion: Already a good choice. To make it lighter, use less olive oil and opt for a smaller portion of fresh mozzarella.

name: carrot_cake
healthier_suggestion: A bowl of Greek yogurt with grated carrots, walnuts, raisins, and cinnamon. This avoids the high sugar and fat from the cake and cream cheese frosting.

name: ceviche
healthier_suggestion: An excellent, healthy, high-protein choice. Serve with baked tortilla chips or sliced cucumbers instead of fried chips.

name: cheese_plate
healthier_suggestion: A small plate focusing on one or two cheeses, accompanied by fresh fruit like apples and grapes instead of crackers and jams.

name: cheesecake
healthier_suggestion: Greek yogurt with berries and a graham cracker crumbled on top. It mimics the creamy texture and flavor with far less fat and sugar.

name: chicken_curry
healthier_suggestion: A curry made with a tomato or broth base instead of coconut cream, loaded with vegetables, served with brown rice or quinoa.

name: chicken_quesadilla
healthier_suggestion: Use a whole-wheat tortilla, half the cheese, double the chicken and veggies (like bell peppers and onions), and serve with salsa and Greek yogurt instead of sour cream.

name: chicken_wings
healthier_suggestion: Baked or air-fried chicken wings with a dry rub or hot sauce instead of a creamy or sweet sauce. This drastically cuts down on fat and calories.

name: chocolate_cake
healthier_suggestion: An avocado chocolate mousse (blended avocado, cocoa powder, sweetener) or fresh berries with a small piece of dark chocolate.

name: chocolate_mousse
healthier_suggestion: Greek yogurt mixed with cocoa powder and a touch of maple syrup. It offers a similar creamy texture with more protein and less fat.

name: churros
healthier_suggestion: A baked cinnamon tortilla strip or apple slices with a cinnamon-yogurt dip.

name: clam_chowder
healthier_suggestion: Manhattan-style (red, broth-based) clam chowder, which avoids the heavy cream and butter.

name: club_sandwich
healthier_suggestion: A turkey sandwich on whole-wheat bread (two slices, not three) with lettuce, tomato, and avocado or hummus instead of bacon and mayonnaise.

name: crab_cakes
healthier_suggestion: Baked or pan-seared crab cakes instead of deep-fried, using more crab and less breadcrumb filler. Serve with a yogurt-based dill sauce.

name: creme_brulee
healthier_suggestion: Vanilla bean Greek yogurt with a sprinkle of raw sugar, or a simple baked custard made with low-fat milk.

name: croque_madame
healthier_suggestion: An open-faced sandwich on whole-wheat toast with lean ham, a little Swiss cheese melted on top, and a poached egg.

name: cup_cakes
healthier_suggestion: A whole-wheat muffin made with fruit (like banana or apple sauce) as a sweetener, topped with a light yogurt frosting.

name: deviled_eggs
healthier_suggestion: A fairly good choice. Make them healthier by using Greek yogurt or avocado instead of mayonnaise for the filling.

name: donuts
healthier_suggestion: A piece of whole-grain toast with cinnamon and a light sweetener, or a baked donut which has significantly less fat.

name: dumplings
healthier_suggestion: Steamed vegetable or lean protein (chicken, shrimp) dumplings are a great choice. Avoid fried versions and use soy sauce sparingly.

name: edamame
healthier_suggestion: This is an excellent, nutrient-dense food. Opt for steamed edamame with a light sprinkle of sea salt.

name: eggs_benedict
healthier_suggestion: Poached eggs on a whole-wheat English muffin with a slice of avocado and tomato instead of Canadian bacon and hollandaise sauce.

name: escargots
healthier_suggestion: The snails themselves are lean protein; the calories come from the garlic butter. Try them cooked in a tomato and herb broth instead.

name: falafel
healthier_suggestion: Baked falafel instead of fried. Serve in a whole-wheat pita or over a salad, and use tahini sauce in moderation.

name: filet_mignon
healthier_suggestion: An excellent lean cut of steak. The key is portion control and pairing it with healthy sides like steamed vegetables or a side salad instead of creamy potatoes or fries.

name: fish_and_chips
serving_size: 1 filet and a medium portion of fries
healthier_suggestion: Baked or grilled fish (like cod) with roasted potato wedges or a side salad. This avoids the deep-frying for both components.

name: foie_gras
healthier_suggestion: A chicken or mushroom pâté. It provides a similar rich, savory spread with significantly less saturated fat.

name: french_fries
healthier_suggestion: Baked sweet potato fries or a simple baked potato. This reduces the fat from frying and adds nutrients.

name: french_onion_soup
healthier_suggestion: A broth-based vegetable or lentil soup. To make French onion soup healthier, use less bread and cheese on top.

name: french_toast
healthier_suggestion: Use whole-grain bread, pan-fry with minimal butter/oil, and top with fresh fruit and a small amount of maple syrup instead of powdered sugar.

name: fried_calamari
healthier_suggestion: Grilled or pan-seared calamari with lemon and herbs. This eliminates the breading and oil from frying.

name: fried_rice
healthier_suggestion: Homemade fried rice using brown rice, double the vegetables, a lean protein like shrimp or chicken, and low-sodium soy sauce.

name: frozen_yogurt
healthier_suggestion: This is already a healthier alternative to ice cream. Keep it healthy by choosing fruit toppings over candy, chocolate, and sugary sauces.

name: garlic_bread
healthier_suggestion: Toasted whole-grain bread rubbed with a fresh garlic clove and a very light drizzle of olive oil.

name: gnocchi
healthier_suggestion: Cauliflower gnocchi or whole-wheat gnocchi. Serve with a simple tomato-based (marinara) sauce instead of a cream or butter sauce.

name: greek_salad
healthier_suggestion: A very healthy choice. The calories come from feta cheese and olive oil. Use both in moderation for an even lighter meal.

name: grilled_cheese_sandwich
healthier_suggestion: Use whole-wheat bread, a smaller amount of a sharp cheese (for more flavor), and add tomato or spinach. Pan-fry with a light cooking spray instead of butter.

name: grilled_salmon
healthier_suggestion: This is an exceptionally healthy meal, rich in protein and omega-3 fatty acids. Pair with steamed vegetables and quinoa for a balanced meal.

name: guacamole
healthier_suggestion: A healthy choice full of good fats. Serve with fresh vegetable sticks (carrots, bell peppers, cucumbers) instead of fried tortilla chips.

name: gyoza
healthier_suggestion: Steamed gyoza (dumplings) are a lighter alternative to the pan-fried version, as it uses less oil.

name: hamburger
healthier_suggestion: A burger made with lean ground turkey or a veggie patty on a whole-wheat bun. Load up on lettuce, tomato, and onion, and use mustard instead of mayo.

name: hot_and_sour_soup
healthier_suggestion: A great low-calorie choice. Be mindful of the high sodium content; look for low-sodium versions if possible.

name: hot_dog
healthier_suggestion: A chicken or turkey sausage on a whole-wheat bun. Top with mustard and sauerkraut instead of cheese or chili.

name: huevos_rancheros
healthier_suggestion: Use poached eggs instead of fried, corn tortillas instead of flour, and serve with fresh salsa and a slice of avocado instead of refried beans and cheese.

name: hummus
healthier_suggestion: Hummus is already very healthy. Serve it with raw vegetable sticks (carrots, celery, bell peppers) instead of pita bread for a lower-carb snack.

name: ice_cream
healthier_suggestion: A fruit sorbet, "nice cream" (blended frozen bananas), or Greek frozen yogurt. These options are typically lower in fat and higher in nutrients.

name: lasagna
healthier_suggestion: Lasagna made with lean ground turkey or lentils, part-skim ricotta cheese, and layers of zucchini or eggplant slices instead of some of the pasta.

name: lobster_bisque
healthier_suggestion: A broth-based seafood soup like cioppino or bouillabaisse. This avoids the heavy cream that drives up the fat and calories in bisque.

name: lobster_roll_sandwich
healthier_suggestion: A Connecticut-style lobster roll (tossed in warm butter) is slightly better than a Maine-style one (mayonnaise). For a truly healthy version, try grilled lobster meat on a bed of greens.

name: macaroni_and_cheese
healthier_suggestion: Use whole-wheat pasta with a sauce made from pureed butternut squash or cauliflower, nutritional yeast, and a small amount of sharp cheddar cheese.

name: macarons
healthier_suggestion: Meringue cookies. They are also light and airy but contain almost no fat. Fresh berries are another light, sweet alternative.

name: miso_soup
healthier_suggestion: An excellent, low-calorie choice. The main health concern is high sodium content, so consume in moderation.

name: mussels
healthier_suggestion: A fantastic, high-protein, and nutrient-rich choice. Opt for mussels steamed in a white wine or tomato broth rather than a creamy or buttery sauce.

name: nachos
healthier_suggestion: A "nacho salad" with a base of lettuce, topped with black beans, grilled chicken, salsa, and a small sprinkle of cheese. Use a few baked chips for crunch.

name: omelette
healthier_suggestion: A great high-protein breakfast. Make it healthier by loading it with vegetables (spinach, mushrooms, peppers), using less cheese, and choosing a side of fruit instead of potatoes.

name: onion_rings
healthier_suggestion: Baked onion rings made with a whole-wheat flour or breadcrumb coating. This significantly cuts down on the oil and fat.

name: oysters
healthier_suggestion: Raw or steamed oysters are incredibly healthy and low-calorie. Avoid fried versions (like Oysters Rockefeller) which add significant fat and calories.

name: pad_thai
healthier_suggestion: Ask for extra vegetables, tofu or shrimp instead of chicken, and request the sauce on the side to control sugar, sodium, and oil.

name: paella
healthier_suggestion: A fairly balanced meal. Opt for a seafood paella loaded with vegetables and go easy on high-fat meats like chorizo.

name: pancakes
healthier_suggestion: Whole-wheat or oatmeal pancakes. Top with fresh fruit, berries, and a small amount of pure maple syrup instead of butter and pancake syrup.

name: panna_cotta
healthier_suggestion: A fruit sorbet or a simple bowl of fresh berries with a dollop of yogurt. This reduces the heavy cream content.

name: peking_duck
healthier_suggestion: Roasted chicken or turkey breast lettuce wraps. This gives a similar experience of wrapping savory meat but with less fat and carbs.

name: pho
healthier_suggestion: Pho is already quite healthy. Maximize its benefits by choosing a lean protein (like rare beef or chicken breast), loading up on fresh herbs and bean sprouts, and using hoisin/sriracha sauce sparingly.

name: pizza
healthier_suggestion: A thin-crust pizza (or cauliflower crust) with tomato sauce, lots of vegetable toppings, and half the normal amount of cheese.

name: pork_chop
healthier_suggestion: A grilled or baked pork chop with the fat trimmed off. This avoids the breading and oil from frying.

name: poutine
healthier_suggestion: Roasted potato wedges topped with a small amount of cheese curds and a lighter, mushroom-based gravy.

name: prime_rib
healthier_suggestion: A leaner cut of beef, such as a filet mignon or sirloin steak, with visible fat trimmed. This significantly reduces the fat content.

name: pulled_pork_sandwich
healthier_suggestion: Pulled chicken sandwich made with a vinegar-based sauce instead of a sugary BBQ sauce, served on a whole-wheat bun or over a salad.

name: ramen
healthier_suggestion: Choose a broth-based (shio or shoyu) ramen over a rich, fatty one (tonkotsu). Ask for extra vegetables and lean protein, and consider eating only half the noodles.

name: ravioli
healthier_suggestion: Butternut squash or spinach and ricotta ravioli served in a light tomato or sage-butter sauce instead of a heavy cream sauce.

name: red_velvet_cake
healthier_suggestion: Angel food cake with fresh strawberries. It provides a light, fluffy texture and sweetness with a fraction of the fat and calories.

name: risotto
healthier_suggestion: A vegetable risotto (like mushroom or asparagus) made with minimal butter and cheese. Use vegetable broth for creaminess.

name: samosa
healthier_suggestion: Baked samosas instead of fried. A lentil-based filling can also be a healthier option than the traditional potato filling.

name: sashimi
healthier_suggestion: An outstandingly healthy, high-protein choice. Pair with a side of edamame or seaweed salad and use low-sodium soy sauce.

name: scallops
healthier_suggestion: A very healthy lean protein. Opt for pan-seared or grilled scallops instead of fried, and serve them with a lemon-herb sauce rather than a heavy cream or butter sauce.

name: seaweed_salad
healthier_suggestion: This is already a very healthy and nutrient-dense side dish. Be mindful of the dressing, which can be high in sugar and sodium.

name: shrimp_and_grits
healthier_suggestion: Grilled shrimp served over grits made with water or milk instead of heavy cream and butter, with minimal cheese.

name: spaghetti_bolognese
healthier_suggestion: Use whole-wheat spaghetti or zucchini noodles ("zoodles"). Make the sauce with lean ground turkey or lentils and pack it with extra vegetables like carrots, celery, and mushrooms.

name: spaghetti_carbonara
healthier_suggestion: A lighter version using whole-wheat pasta, turkey bacon, and a sauce made with Greek yogurt or pureed cauliflower to mimic creaminess, saving the egg yolk and a sprinkle of parmesan for flavor.

name: spring_rolls
healthier_suggestion: Fresh or "summer" rolls (not fried) made with rice paper and filled with fresh vegetables and shrimp or tofu. They offer all the flavor with a fraction of the fat.

name: steak
healthier_suggestion: Choose a leaner cut like sirloin, flank steak, or filet mignon. Trim all visible fat, grill or broil instead of pan-frying in butter, and stick to a smaller portion size (4-6 oz).

name: strawberry_shortcake
healthier_suggestion: A bowl of fresh strawberries topped with a dollop of Greek yogurt or a small scoop of angel food cake.

name: sushi
healthier_suggestion: Opt for simple rolls with fish and vegetables (like a tuna or cucumber roll). Ask for brown rice, and avoid rolls with tempura (fried items), spicy mayo, and cream cheese.

name: tacos
healthier_suggestion: Tacos with grilled fish or chicken in soft corn tortillas, loaded with fresh lettuce, salsa, and avocado instead of cheese and sour cream.

name: takoyaki
healthier_suggestion: This is a fried snack, so it is hard to make healthy. A better option for a savory Japanese snack would be steamed edamame or a simple seaweed salad.

name: tiramisu
healthier_suggestion: Coffee-flavored Greek yogurt with a sprinkle of cocoa powder and a vanilla wafer. This captures the flavor profile without the heavy mascarpone cheese and raw eggs.

name: tuna_tartare
healthier_suggestion: This is a very healthy high-protein choice. Ensure the sauce is soy-based rather than creamy or mayonnaise-based, and serve with cucumber slices instead of fried wonton chips.

name: waffles
healthier_suggestion: Whole-grain or protein waffles. Top with fresh berries, a dollop of Greek yogurt, and a small amount of pure maple syrup instead of butter and whipped cream.
